intro: Aceratium ochraceum, commonly known as the yellow-flowered dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Its medicinal properties have been studied for their potential anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects.
